newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - September 4.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - September 4.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said modern infrastructural facilities would be built in the port city of Chittagong to attract foreign investment in Bangladesh.

Opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party has accused the ruling Awami League of using the administration to "forcibly" get its candidates returned in the by-election, due on Thursday in 15 constituencies.
Authorities have withdrawn all officers and constables from a police outpost in central Manikganj district for their connections with drug smugglers.
Some 270 Rohingya refugees were sent to their homeland in Burma on Tuesday, bringing the number of refugees repatriated to 204,565 since the process began in September 1992.
Bangladesh is amending its century-old Trust Act to allow investments of provident and gratuity funds in the securities market.
Turkish ambassador in Dhaka Kemal Ozcan Davas said his country's entrepreneurs were eager to invest in Bangladesh's energy and telecommunication sector. -- Dhaka Newsroom 880-2-506363
